qas.question: When did Imperial announce their science park program at the Wye Campus?

context: In <a0_0><b9_0>December 2005<b9_0/><a0_0/>, <b12_0>Imperial<b12_0/> announced a <b10_0>science park programme<b10_0/> at <a3_0>the <a4_0><b11_0>Wye campus<b11_0/><a4_0/><a3_0/>, with extensive housing; however, this was abandoned in <a1_0><a5_0>September 2006<a5_0/><a1_0/> following complaints that the proposal infringed on Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty, and that the true scale of the scheme, which could have raised <a6_0>£110m<a6_0/> for the College, was known to Kent and Ashford Councils and their consultants but concealed from <a7_0>the public<a7_0/>. One commentator observed that Imperial's scheme reflected "the state of democracy in Kent, the transformation of a renowned scientific college into a grasping, highly aggressive, neo-corporate institution, and the defence of the status of an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty – throughout England, not just Wye – against rampant greed backed by the connivance of two important local authorities. <a8_0>Wye College campus<a8_0/> was finally closed in <a2_0>September 2009<a2_0/>.
